title.narrative: 2.2. BASIC WATER SUPPLY

description.narrative: More children and their families in targeted vulnerable communities have equitable and sustainable access to improved drinking water facilities, which contributes to Disaster Risk Reduction, Environmental Sustainability, Water, Water (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, more children and their families are living in an open defecation free environment, using improved drinking water sources and adopting improved hygiene practices

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: More children and their families in targeted vulnerable communities have equitable and sustainable access to improved drinking water facilities

description.narrative: An additional 510,000 vulnerable children and family members (127% of 2019 target) now access gender sensitive basic water service. UNICEF supported achievements represent 22% of WASH sector achievements. UNICEF effective and timely response to the cholera epidemic in Blue Nile and Sennar states that reached 1.4 million affected population with disinfected water has effectively contributed to the dramatic reduction of reported cases. A climate-resilient integrated water resource management approach in Darfur and Eastern states is helping to operationalize the humanitarian-development nexus. The national strategy for the sustainable management of hafirs was derived from the findings of a UNICEF supported study. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019
